Posts.Content: That’s really good news enjoy your drink :-) Kathy xx
Posts.Title: Pretty good news Julesxx

Posts.Content: Hi Sadie I have chest/back discomfort still - it's 9 months since thoracentesis and biopsy - and I've ruled out mets - but started work with a physio who showed me how out of balance I had become - (one shoulder about 10cm lower thatn the other) and working on that is helping - it might be worth checking out your discomfort isn't partly muscular? Kathy
Posts.Title: MBC Mets to the Pleura

Posts.Content: Good morning Yes, mets to the pleura - diagnosed because of pleural effusion, the pleural effusion was drained twice but now that the chemo/hercptin/perjeta is working the pleural effusion has gone. I'm not clear what pleural consolidation is, but I agree that if the nodes haven't changed that's got to be good - I've got an area that still shows up on CT scans but Oncologist thinks it could be scare tissue from the biopsy etc, good luck with treatment Kathy
Posts.Title: MBC Mets to the Pleura

Posts.Content: Hi Grace Lots of people on here on the same combination - I find side effects are very manageable but I get the aching back and ribs - I think it’s the xgeva more than the others but not sure yet - steam room helps and yoga and ibruprofen gel - got rubbish nails too but a small price to pay for survival for now. I’m doing CBD oil too - again a lot on here about that - consensus being I think that it doesn’t cure cancer but helps with low level pain - I think it helps me sleep :-) Kathy
Posts.Title: Any input would help

Posts.Content: Hi Grace I’m on Herceptin and Perjeta too and they do keep a lot of people going for a long time - but as and when they don’t seem to be working any more there are lots of other options. Could also be the bone mets were always there but just noticed now - my experience was that they only picked up the bone mets to spine when they were going/gone - as I understand it the spaces where they were will always be visible - ( I’m on xgeva too for bone mets - make sure you get your teeth checked if they didn’t already tell you that as dental work is problematic on xgeva ) so it might be that the bone mets are not signs of treatment not working - all the best Kathy xx
Posts.Title: Any input would help

Posts.Content: Yoga I think should be good too but with a teacher who knows something about lymphedema :-) I don’t have lymphedema but post surgery gentle yoga helped a lot with getting mobility back - hope it’s going well Kathy
Posts.Title: What kind of exercise is helpful for lymphedema?

Posts.Content: I think you might have to be a bit more spontaneous - she might have times of the day when she feels better and/or days when she wakes up and has less pain - you might also be able to drive or persuade someone to drive to the things you want to see or do and with a parking permit make anything involve minimal energy for her - I hope you get to do some nice things with her Kathy
Posts.Title: Caregiver Creative solutions

Posts.Content: Dear Angelica Agree with what people say, I work in mental health and would agree with the value of both those small steps towards feeling as though it's manageable if not normal yet - like walking each day, doing ten minutes of yoga, meeting a friend etc, but also counselling/therapy. I go private for therapy so she's not connecting to the health services and I think that's probably easier because we can talk about the treatment expereinces etc from a distance and she can feel like she's really on my side - my counsellor has experience of chronic illness too which helps - if you can find anyone who gets this then it's got to be useful - so then I guess this site helps enormously too - because it's the only place where people really do get it Kathy (Wales)
Posts.Title: Depressed...tnbc

Posts.Content: Dear Angelica I hope being here on this site is giving you some hope - it’s one of the things that really helped me in the first few months post diagnosis - but also seeing a therapist fortnightly - one with some experience of chronic illness - it sort of allowed me to save up some of the darkest feelings to share with her - but I guess you need the right person - take care Kathy
Posts.Title: Depression..
